title: Cognitive Radio System Performance Analysis and Deep Learning-Based Predictive Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service/in-service teachers exploring methods to apply advanced scientific technologies in real educational settings, with practice-centered classes using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically analyze key performance metrics of cognitive radio communication systems (e.g., outage probability, system throughput)
Learners can explain methods for real-time prediction of communication system performance using deep learning-based predictive models
Learners can comparatively evaluate system design cases applying NOMA (Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access) and relay selection techniques
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
